__e: But Kevin's not in trouble with the cops anymore, so why's he still trying to find her?
Oh, they're just staring at me, because my brother's in some kind of trouble with the police.
Listen, man, I got a problem. I think I'm in trouble with the mob or a major insurance carrier.
- Really? Look, if we do have the same dad, he's at least half-crazy, fully troubled, and I've got plenty of both, inside and out.
That means he's in serious trouble, and the only way you can help him is if you tell me where he is.
The reason I brought us here is because... someone was in trouble, and the person who needed help was not a client.
